answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Tabitha,
Sierra Vista, AZ documented on page 7 of this document the challenges of building a new pavilion.
http://icma.org/Documents/QuestionAnswer/Document/7551
The Mount Pigsah Arboretum in Eugene, OR has posted the blueprints for their Pavilions on their website:
http://www.mountpisgaharboretum.com/weddings-and-rentals/pavilion-blueprints/
Trillium Dell Timberworks has a nice information page related to various outdoor structures. 
http://www.trilliumdell.com/timber-frame-pergolas-porches-pavilions.html
Finally, here are the pavillion blueprints for a park in Minonk, IL.
http://www.minonktalk.com/pavplans.htm
I hope this has helped. Please let us know if you have other questions or would like more information.
Max Moline
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Tabitha Riley
text:
Culpeper County Parks and Recreation staff is pursuing information on picnic shelters and/or pavilions in order to compile a portfolio to reach out to service organizations requesting their help to build shelters/pavilions in county parks.  
In order to do so, staff is seeking copies building blueprints of any size and the associated costs, to compile an lists of options for these groups to review. Anything you could send would be most helpful.  If possible, pictures of completed shelter/ pavilion would also be appreciated.
thank you.
title: Pavilion / Shelter blueprints & costs - Share Please?
